meanings.definition: Charge (a battery) before its intended use.
meanings.sent1: I always make sure to precharge my phone before going out.
meanings.sent2: Remember to precharge your laptop before your long flight.
meanings.sent3: The superhero precharged his energy before the big battle.
meanings.sent4: She precharged her determination for the upcoming challenges.
meanings.sent5: Precharging your mind with positivity can help you face any obstacle.

meanings.definition: The act of charging something in advance.
meanings.sent1: Precharging of devices is common practice in our household.
meanings.sent2: The precharging of the camera battery saved the day during the photo shoot.
meanings.sent3: The precharging of the car's battery made it ready for the road trip.
meanings.sent4: His precharging of knowledge before the exam paid off with excellent grades.
meanings.sent5: The precharging of excitement for the event made the anticipation even more thrilling.
